task.title: Lubricate the Mechanics
task.shortdesc: Portable typewriters generally do not need regular lubrication, as they are protected by their casing. However, metal-on-metal components can sometimes develop friction, which will require occasional lubrication to remedy.

step.cmd: Identify metal-on-metal connections, gears, and pivot points that seem to be hesitant in movement or completely stiff.
step.info: Common areas that will need lubrication include the carriage rails, and internal pivot points, levers, and gears.

step.cmd: Using a precision applicator, such as a small pipet or medicine dropper, apply one to two drops of oil where needed, immediately wiping away the excess with a rag or cotton swab.
